required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Limited Market Release - MotionSense Clinical Use Evaluation
clinical_study.official_title: FS5 Limited Market Release - MotionSense Clinical Use Evaluation

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective evaluation of patient compliance and prescribed home exercise program using MotionSense wearable system during recovery from primary total knee arthroplasty.

detailed_description.textblock: During the proposed study, the MotionSense wearable system will be used by patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty (TKA) surgery leading up to and after their surgery. The patients will be using the system to monitor their recovery during daily activities, log daily pain scores and patient reported outcomes while also supporting their prescribed home exercise program. Each patient will thereby participate in outpatient physiotherapy in line with their current standard of care, while the physiotherapist will leverage the opportunities of the presented platform to give the patient personalized reminders for their patient-specific home exercise program. The surgeon / research nurse will additionally be able to monitor the patients recovery remotely as the sensor / app data is shared to the OrthoLogIQ platform.

primary_outcome.description: Patient daily and longitudinal use of Motionsense relative to date of surgery (DOS)

secondary_outcome.description: Assigned exercises relative to date of surgery (DOS)

arm_group.description: Using Motionsense from pre-op to 90 days post-op during the recovery after primary TKA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Planned for unilateral total knee surgery in the coming 4 weeks
- Age 50 to 80
- Owns a smart phone
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI exceeding 35
- Severe skin conditions
